Text: Professor Norman Sandridge of @KallionLeaders is a brilliant classicist and political thinker. Check out his Kallion Circle on-line seminar, based on my book Unthinkable, to develop your democratic leadership skills. See below for details. https://t.co/9qOBiq5hBN

Democracy Summer has been the heart and soul of my campaign since my first election. Today, I'm ecstatic to welcome 57 House colleagues as partner campaigns as we galvanize more than 1000 true-blue young activists across America to defend and expand our House majority! https://t.co/himlUq6QGH

I called Trump the "Inciter-in-Chief” at trial because it captured both what he was doing—exhorting his mob to storm the Capitol—and what he was not doing: defending the Republic as our president. https://t.co/zCNS2a6qoF

A Socratic exchange with @tribelaw produced a metaphor for trial: Trump wasn’t shouting fire in a crowded theater; he was the town fire chief sending his followers to burn the theater down. When calls for help came in, he delighted in the chaos and egged on the mob. @harperaudio https://t.co/7sAMYerPlb

"Unthinkable" just hit the NYT audiobook bestseller list.  While writing the book was cathartic in many ways, reading it aloud was wrenching. I’m grateful for all who told me it was worth it and that hearing the book has been a profound experience. @harperaudio https://t.co/FZtsF7Lbee

The @January6thCmte hearings are coming this spring. Based on what our investigation has uncovered, we will analyze the attack on our democracy and the continuing threat of coup and insurrection. How close did we come to losing our democracy on 1/6? Who was responsible?

In Unthinkable, I remember a conversation I had with Tommy about people who choose deceit and power over truth and justice. Tommy asked: How can we ever stop people hellbent on force and fraud? @HarperAudio https://t.co/LJPponi1tf
I want to share my thanks with Mads Carter for her journalistic vision and doggedness as she filmed and produced this documentary.

For 3 years, filmmaker Madeleine Carter followed me as I challenged Trump’s transgressions. In the process, she captured harrowing, tragic and profound moments in my family’s life, compiling them into her film "Love and the Constitution,” which aired last night on @MSNBC.

Electoral college fraud is voter fraud. If one person can’t cast a false vote for a fictional voter, one person can’t falsely represent himself as a state elector to steal the whole election. Elected officials should stop supporting electoral college fraud.

Thank you @ConnieSchultz for this wonderful review, which is the kind I only could have hoped for. Wishing you solace and peace on your journey. May your brother’s memory be a blessing to you and your family. https://t.co/h1sQHsuJBp

Expecting snow this weekend, but my mind is on Democracy Summer! Our team is galvanizing the next wave of true-blue organizers with our biggest year yet! Applications open soon—sign up below to be the first to know when:

https://t.co/ifzoZ6ALLV

I came to Louisville to do the Kentucky Author’s Forum and special surprise—the amazing Lonnie Ali, whose husband Muhammad grew up here, gave me a tour of the museum in his Center. He was a world champ not only of boxing but of peace and human rights. https://t.co/1tVY6JM6nX

The @January6thCmte hearings will expose each level of the assault against the peaceful transfer of power on Jan. 6. If democracy is to survive and grow, Americans need to know the truth about the seditious conspiracies and violence that nearly overturned the will of the people.

Dr. King organized for voting rights, civil rights, fair housing, integrated schools—and for peace and an end to the Vietnam War. His courage changed the lives of millions of Americans—including my family.  

https://t.co/u2kHixh3AU

I have now signed 500 books for my friends at Politics and Prose so the shelves are replenished. Thx to Julia Holland and Allen Watke (pictured) of P&P for making sure the shelves are stocked, and to owners Bradley Graham and Lissa Muscatine for the great event. https://t.co/t7nPaTmS0u

Against the whole matrix of democracy suppression—voter suppression, partisan gerrymandering, right-wing court-packing and the filibuster—the House struck back and passed the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act today. 
Your turn, Senators.

Tommy left us a legacy of profound compassion, empathy, and concern for others. In honor of his birthday on Jan 30th, friends and family around the world are completing acts of kindness in his memory.  Join in by sharing your act using the form below or by tagging #TodayforTommy. https://t.co/QKHsKc2UVR
Maryland has just lost a great political force and a man of overwhelming kindness and decency, Tufail Ahmad. He was my friend and he will be missed sorely in our community.

I want to thank my friends and the democracy patriots out there for reading my book and propelling it, in its first week, to the top of the NYT Bestseller List. Your comments fill my family with strength and give us boundless hope for the future. 

https://t.co/vnrf6RknpM

@JerkyTough @maddow @MaddowBlog Please tell your son that is my best review yet!  

PS. He sounds precocious but please monitor his reading a bit since there is some tough stuff in there. I did write a book for young people about the Constitution called We the Students!

I’m observing the anniversary of Trump’s failed coup and violent insurrection of 1/6/21 by honoring Ofc. Hodges, Dunn, Fanone and Gonnell, & all who fought to defend democracy. Trump wants us to forget, but we’ll make sure people remember.  Please share how you're feeling today. https://t.co/IU1dQCbRGb

"Unthinkable,” my book about Tommy, and his passions and gifts, and struggle with depression, was released today. It’s also about the Jan 6 insurrection, my work as lead impeachment manager, and the ongoing struggle for democracy. Thx for standing by me through thick and thin.

Please join us in wishing a very happy birthday to our favorite Congressman, constitutional scholar, and defender of Democracy! 

Jamie, we hope this is your best year yet!

—Team Raskin https://t.co/L2tYGYde54

Thank you to our enlightening speakers for teaching 350 young people about the historic and continuing struggle for voting rights and strong democracy in America. We mourn the loss of our first speaker of the summer, the great Bob Moses, and strive to carry on in his spirit.

Thank you to the 23 Members of Congress that joined us as Partner Campaigns and to the DCCC for helping us expand our program across America and providing an unforgettable learning experience for the Fellows.

Congrats to 350 Dem Summer Fellows across the US for completing the 2021 nationwide program and preparing to become organizers and leaders for strong democracy in America! We are proud of what you have accomplished and look forward to working with you to defend Democracy in 2022!
